p:
We estimated fractal dimension using the box-counting method. The method is based on overlaying an image
A ∈
R
2
with a grid of squares of size r and counting the number of squares, N( r) necessary to cover the object in the thresholded image. The number of boxes of size r needed to cover a fractal object follows a power-law
N
( r )
∝
r
− D
, where D is the box-counting fractal dimension obtained from the linear portion of the log[ N( r)] versus log[ r] plot. The algorithm is applied to binary images obtained after segmentation of original color/gray scale images with a threshold.
